Package <Unnamed>

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BatchBuilder
    Implements the Builder design pattern for step-by-step construction of a BatchExecutor instance.
    BatchConsole
    This class creates a console interface utility designed to read arguments from the command-line.
    BatchConsole.BatchImageBuilder
    Following the Builder design pattern, this inner class extends from the inner abstract class Builder of the abstract outer class BatchImageEngine.
    BatchExecutor
    Automates the batch processing of image files by copying, renaming, and chronologically sorting them based on their EXIF metadata, such as DateTimeOriginal.
    BatchImageEngine
    Automates the batch processing of image files by copying the original files to a target directory, renaming them with a specified prefix, sorting them based on their original Date Taken attribute, and updating the creation date, last modification time, and last access time to match with the original Date Taken attribute, found in the image metadata.
    BatchImageEngine.Builder
    This inner class implements a builder design pattern to construct an object in a step-by-step fashion, providing a clean and efficient approach for instantiation.
    DefaultTimestampComparator
    Comparator that sorts MetaMedia objects by timestamp in ascending order.
    DescendingTimestampComparator
    Comparator that sorts MetaMedia objects by timestamp in descending order.
    MetaMedia
    Represents metadata for a single media file, including file path, capture date, file format, and metadata availability.
    TestScanner
    Obtains metadata from selected supported image file formats.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    BatchErrorException
    This exception is thrown when the running application is terminated abruptly.
